solution_line_template: {lettuce_heads} heads of lettuce at ${lettuce_price_per_head} apiece is {lettuce_heads}*${lettuce_price_per_head}=$<<{lettuce_heads}*{lettuce_price_per_head}={lettuce_cost_per_customer}>>{lettuce_cost_per_customer}.

Thus, each customer purchases ${lettuce_cost_per_customer}+${tomato_cost_per_customer}=$<<{lettuce_cost_per_customer}+{tomato_cost_per_customer}={total_cost_per_customer}>>{total_cost_per_customer} in lettuce and tomatoes per month.

Therefore, if {num_customers_per_month} customers per month spend ${total_cost_per_customer} on lettuce and tomatoes, then the store will receive ${total_cost_per_customer}*{num_customers_per_month}=$<<{total_cost_per_customer}*{num_customers_per_month}={total_monthly_sales}>>{total_monthly_sales} per month on sales of lettuce and tomatoes.
